official-title.#text: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to clarify the treatment of general welfare benefits provided by Indian tribes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives September 16, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Tribal General Welfare Exclusion Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Tribal General Welfare Exclusion Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by inserting before
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Part III of subchapter B of

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: the following new section:

text.#text: Gross income does not include the value of any Indian general welfare benefit.

quote.#tail: includes any payment made or services provided to or on behalf of a member of an Indian tribe (or any spouse or dependent of such a member) pursuant to an Indian tribal government program, but only if—

text.#text: For purposes of this section, the term
the program is administered under specified guidelines and does not discriminate in favor of members of the governing body of the tribe, and
the benefits provided under such program—
are available to any tribal member who meets such guidelines,
are for the promotion of general welfare,
are not lavish or extravagant, and
are not compensation for services.
For purposes of this section—

quote.#tail: includes any agencies or instrumentalities of an Indian tribal government and any Alaska Native regional or village corporation, as defined in, or established pursuant to, the

text.#text: For purposes of this section, the term

quote.#tail: has the meaning given such term by

text.#text: The term

, and
shall, in consultation with the Tribal Advisory Committee (as established under
), establish guidelines for what constitutes lavish or extravagant benefits with respect to Indian tribal government programs.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 3(a) of the Tribal General Welfare Exclusion Act of 2013
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Tribal General Welfare Exclusion Act of 2013/s:3/ss:a

text.#text: The
A program shall not fail to be treated as an Indian tribal government program solely by reason of the program being established by tribal custom or government practice.

Any items of cultural significance, reimbursement of costs, or cash honorarium for participation in cultural or ceremonial activities for the transmission of tribal culture shall not be treated as compensation for services.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by inserting before the item relating to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: part III of subchapter B of chapter 1 of such Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: the following new item:

text.#text: The table of sections for

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , as added by this Act, shall be resolved in favor of Indian tribal governments and deference shall be given to Indian tribal governments for the programs administered and authorized by the tribe to benefit the general welfare of the tribal community.

text.#text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years for which the period of limitation on refund or credit under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: expires before the end of the 1-year period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act, refund or credit of such overpayment (to the extent attributable to such amendments) may, nevertheless, be made or allowed if claim therefor is filed before the close of such 1-year period.
